text: Marie Thérèse de Bourbon (1666 – 1732Nancy Mitford, The Sun King (New York: New York Review Books, 2012), pp. 87 note, 176) was briefly the titular (in title only) Queen consort of Poland in 1697. She was the daughter of Henri Jules, Prince of Condé and of Anne Henriette of Bavaria.Emmanuel Le Roy Ladurie, Saint-Simon and the Court of Louis XIV (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 2001), pp. 308, 415 As a member of France's reigning House of Bourbon, she was a Princess of the blood. She was entitled to be addressed as Her/Your Serene Highness. ==Life== She was married to François Louis, Prince of Conti.Alexandre Maral, La chapelle royale de Versailles sous Louis XIV: cérémonial, liturgie et musique (Wavre: Mardaga, 2010), p. 140, note 226 After her husband's death, she turned her attention to the renovation of the Conti residences. She began with the Hôtel de Conti. It is now called the Ministère de l'artisanat, 80 rue de Lille, Paris 7e. She commissioned Robert de Cotte, Premier Architecte du Roi, to do the work. Marie Thérèse died on 22 February 1732 at the Hôtel de Conti. Her death was probably due to the syphilis she may have caught from her husband. She was buried at the Église Saint-André des Arcs, in L'Isle d'Adam. ==Issue== # Marie Anne de Bourbon (18 April 1689 - 21 March 1720) married her cousin Louis Henri de Bourbon, Duke of Bourbon but had no children. # Unnamed child (18 November 1693 - 22 November 1693) died young. # Unnamed son but given the title of Prince de La Roche-sur-Yon. (1 December 1694 - 25 April 1698) died young. # Louis Armand de Bourbon, Prince of Conti (10 November 1695 - 4 May 1727) married Louise Élisabeth de Bourbon and had children. # Louise Adélaïde de Bourbon (2 November 1696 – 20 November 1750) died unmarried. # Unamed daughter known as Mademoiselle d'Alais (19 November 1697 - 13 August 1699) died young. # Louis François de Bourbon, Count of Alais (27 July 1703 - 21 January 1704) died young. ==Titles and styles== *1 February 1666 - 22 January 1688 Her Serene Highness Mademoiselle de Bourbonhttp://www.heraldica.org/topics/france/frroyal.htm#sang Style of HSH and further information on Princes of the Blood - Other princes of the blood were only entitled to Most Serene Highness (Altesse Sérénissime) from 1651 to 1824, when they received the style of Royal Highness *22 January 1688 - 9 February 1709 Her Serene Highness The Princess of Conti *9 February 1709 - 22 February 1732 Her Serene Highness The Dowager Princess of Conti == References == ==Other websites== * Marie Thérèse de Bourbon Category:1666 births Category:1733 deaths Category:People from Paris Category:House of Bourbon (Condé branch) Category:House of Bourbon (Conti branch)
title: Marie Thérèse de Bourbon
